Kaio Silveira

Father & Husband. Web Developer. Agilist.
Easily found at restaurants of japanese food or running around the city.

About me

I am a developer. That kind of developer that cares about improvements: Process, methodology, code quality, delivery frequency, team maturity, individual. Improvements of any kind. Because I think that when you know to recognize your success, but always looks foward towards to fix what went wrong or not finished up as expected, everybody wins: you, the team, the company.
Professionally, I've been working with market-consolidated technologies alongside agile teams, always trying to participate in each part of the product development, trying to give relevant insights that will make users happy to use them.
At my spare time, I used to run, and I love it. The feeling of freedom, the air in your face, the mind processing random thoughts, that's just awesome.

Professional and academic backgrounds

Mai/2018

Tech Lead / Senior Fullstack Developer: Scopus (Bradesco)

My time with Scopus (Bradesco) Team was great. There I have learned to work in a high-expectation environment, in a project with a defined and unchangeable deadline, and even so we have deliveried great software and leave the client very satisfied.

Mar/2018

Fullstack Developer: Ornito

My time with Ornito was short, but that few sprints there shown me a lot about the really agile mindset, delivery-focused teams, remote work, flexible work journey and so on.

Mar/2017

Fullstack (MEAN and .NET) Developer: IsQuik

My time at Isquik was pretty nice. There, I've improved my skills with frontend development, something I was looking for. Also, I've worked with NodeJS, Express and MongoDB alongside AngularJS, the bundle known as "MEAN Stack". Also, my previous background with the .NET framework was useful and I could develop new features and perform maintainances at the API's we had.

Apr/2015

.NET Developer: Geosiga

Geosiga was very special to me, mainly because it was my first job experience. There I learned to write automated tests using Selenium and quickly learned the MVC pattern with the .NET framework to develop web applications. But, most important, I've received, in a short period of time, a lot of knowledge about new technologies and start to develop my agile mindset using SCRUM and some technics of Extreme Programming.

Dec/2014

Information Technology Technician at ETEC de Mau√°

At ETEC I have had my first contact with programming, first using C and then moving to C# with the .NET framework.
After that, I took a deep dive into the tech universe and made this my own world.
The course gave a pretty important background that allowed me to face the market's dynamism.
